sentence.Network_en: The Congress wants to reverse the reforms and usurp the power of the presidency.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'appropriate a right wrongfully'): from Old French usurper, from Latin usurpare 'seize for use'

entry.def: If you say that someone usurps a job, role, title, or position, they take it from someone when they have no right to do this.

example.ex: Did she usurp his place in his mother's heart?...
example.tran: 她取代了他在他母亲心目中的地位吗？

example.ex: The Congress wants to reverse the reforms and usurp the power of the presidency.
example.tran: 议会企图颠覆改革，夺取总统权力。

means.word_mean: 1. seize and take control without authority and possibly with force; take as one's right or possession;

sentences.sentence: "He assumed to himself the right to fill all positions in the town"
"She seized control of the throne after her husband died"
"gloom had usurped mirth at the party after the news of the terorist act broke"
